New Records: West Indies scored 137/5 in 19 overs, their highest score in the match; Papua New Guinea scored 136/8 in 20 overs; Roston Chase scored 42 off 27 deliveries, a key record in the match
Key Match Events: The match turned on Roston Chase and Andre Russell's partnership after West Indies were 97-5; Chase hit crucial boundaries in the last over to secure a 5-wicket win; Papua New Guinea's Sese Bau scored a valiant 50
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies captain Rovman Powell praised Papua New Guinea's effort and mentioned they need to improve their run prevention; Papua New Guinea captain Assad Vala acknowledged their missed opportunities and looked forward to future matches
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the opening game of the 2024 T20 World Cup; Papua New Guinea showed fighting spirit but couldn't convert crucial moments into wins
